content.question: Boxes <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> and <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> are pushed horizontally the same distance by forces with varying magnitudes. The magnitudes of the forces exerted on each box as a function of their positions are shown in the graph. What is the ratio <math alttext="W sub X to W sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></msub></math> of the work done on each box by the forces?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
